articles.title: DPRK Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Meets with Russian Ambassador
articles.content:
DPRK Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Meets with Russian Ambassador
Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Han Song Ryol, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, on May 25 met with Alexandr Matsegora, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, to exchange views on the matters of mutual concern including the present situation of the Korean peninsula.
					Han referred to the danger of the joint military drill of the U.S. for aggression and its sanctions against the DPRK, adding that a priority to ensuring the regional stability is to stop such moves.
					
					The Russian ambassador underlined the importance to strengthen the communication between the two countries under the present situation, reiterating the Russian government's stand to oppose the DPRK-targeted military threat and sanctions of the U.S., and hoped that the bilateral relations would steadily develop even under the complicated situation.

articles.title: General Director of European Department of DPRK Foreign Ministry Meets His Czech Counterpart
articles.content:
General Director of European Department of DPRK Foreign Ministry Meets His Czech Counterpart
Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Son Gyong, general director of European Department 2 of the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK on a visit to the Czech Republic, met Martin Klepetko, director for Asia and the Pacific of the Czech Foreign Ministry, on May 24 and discussed issues of developing bilateral relations and exchanged views on the situation of the Korean peninsula.
					 The DPRK side informed the Czech side of its stand to further the relations between the two countries and said that it is necessary to withdraw the U.S. nuclear threat and hostile policy toward the DPRK in order to defuse the tension on the Korean peninsula and ensure regional peace and stability.
					
					 The opposite side said that the Czech Republic with long-standing relations with the DPRK has deep interest in developing the relations between the two countries, expressing the will to further exchange and cooperation in education, culture and other fields depending on the de-escalation of the tension.
					
					 Expressing concern over the deteriorating situation on the Korean peninsula, it said that the Czech Republic would strive to contribute to the peaceful settlement of the Korean peninsula issue through dialogue.

articles.title: Vice Foreign Minister Snipes at U.S. and Its Allies' Talk about "Additional Sanctions" against DPRK
articles.content:
Vice Foreign Minister Snipes at U.S. and Its Allies' Talk about "Additional Sanctions" against DPRK
Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK Pak Myong Guk issued a statement Friday as the U.S. and its followers are calling for "additional sanctions" on the DPRK, much upset by its consecutive steps for bolstering the nuclear force.
					 As its scenario was rebuffed by many countries not wanting the escalation of tensions, the U.S. has gone sly to create an "atmosphere" critical of the DPRK in a bid to attain its sordid purpose, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 Some countries known as U.S. allies respectively issued protest statements at the U.S. beck and call.
					
					 The DPRK does not pay even the slightest attention to these countries which blindly toe the U.S. line, away from justice and principle.
					
					 What the DPRK would like to take note of is the fact that a few countries are dancing to the U.S. tune even though they are not its allies.
					
					 They termed the DPRK's rocket launches violation of "resolutions" of the UN Security Council. If the steps of the DPRK are the reason of their unreasonable behavior, it is an expression of their ignorance or deliberate defiance of the fact that the "resolutions" are just the product of double-standards devoid of any legal grounds.
					
					 The DPRK requested the UN Security Council several times to clarify the legal grounds of its "resolutions on sanctions" on the DPRK and, to this end, proposed an international forum of legal experts to the UN Secretariat. But it has not yet received any answer.
					
					 What is all the more problematic is that the few countries failed to utter even a word about the nuclear carrier task forces and strategic nuclear subs brought by the U.S. to the waters off the Korean peninsula to push the situation to the brink of a war, even though they talk much about peace and stability on the peninsula and the region while "faulting" and expressing "concerns" about the DPRK's rocket launches.
					
					 They do not dare mention the U.S. moves when talking about the situation on the Korean peninsula, the most typical characteristics of vassal states bereft of independence and courage.
					
					 The DPRK has bolstered the nuclear deterrence for self-defence in every way to tackle the U.S. extreme hostile policy and nuclear threat and blackmail.
					
					 To turn away from the root cause of the escalation of tensions but to denounce the DPRK's inevitable option for self-defence caused by it is just an act of "flattering" and "brown-nosing" to the backstage manipulators, rather than an expression of stand prompted by the respect for international law and regulations and the aspiration for world peace and stability.
					
					 If these countries are truly interested in international peace and stability, they should not toe the U.S. line but take the lead in realizing international justice.

articles.title: Russian Guests Here
articles.content:
Russian Guests Here
Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) - Konstantin Asmolov, a senior researcher of the Center for Research on Korea at the Institute of the Far East under the Russian Academy of Sciences, and his party arrived here Friday.

articles.title: Choe Ryong Hae Inspects Chollima Steel Complex
articles.content:
Choe Ryong Hae Inspects Chollima Steel Complex
Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea, vice-chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and vice-chairman of the C.C., WPK, made a field survey of the Chollima Steel Complex.
					 Going round various parts of the complex, he encouraged the workers to perform bigger feats in their production drive.
					
					 Then, a consultative meeting was convened to take steps for effecting innovations in the iron and steel production.

articles.title: DPRK Players Return from Second Asian Juniors Athletics Championships
articles.content:
DPRK Players Return from Second Asian Juniors Athletics Championships
Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- DPRK players came back on Friday after taking part in the Second Asian Juniors Athletics Championships held in Thailand from May 20 to 23.
					 The championships brought together more than 460 men and women players from 40 countries, including the DPRK, India and Chinese Taipei, and regions.
					
					 Choe Il Gyong came first in women's 3,000 meter race and Kim Hyang Suk in women's 2,000 meter hurdle race.
					
					 Kim Mi Hae bagged a bronze medal in women's 2,000 meter hurdle race.

articles.title: Organic Fertilizer Enjoys Popularity in Agricultural Sector
articles.content:
Organic Fertilizer Enjoys Popularity in Agricultural Sector
Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Organic fertilizers have been widely introduced into the agricultural sector of the DPRK.
					 Among them is blue-green algae bio-fertilizer. The bioactivity fertilizer raises the content of useful ingredients needed for the growth of crops by multiplying blue-green algae in soil.
					
					 Last year alone, the Kisang Co-op Farm in Yonggwang County, South Hamgyong Province and the township co-op farm in Kangryong County, South Hwanghae Province introduced the fertilizer, thus boosting their grain output.
					
					 Now the fertilizer is widely being introduced in many co-op farms as it increases the fertility of soil and sharply reduces the amount of consumption of chemical fertilizers. They include the Jangchon Vegetable Cooperative Farm in Sadong District, Pyongyang and co-op farms in Pukchong County of South Hamgyong Province, Kilju County of North Hamgyong Province, Phyongwon County of South Phyongan Province, Pakchon County of North Phyongan Province and Singye County of North Hwanghae Province.

articles.title: Sci-tech Successes Made in Cinematic Art Field
articles.content:
Sci-tech Successes Made in Cinematic Art Field
Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- The Research Institute of Cinema Science of the DPRK has solved sci-tech problems conducive to the development of cinematic art.
					 It designed and manufactured stereophonic facilities by its own efforts and installed them to cinemas and halls in Pyongyang.
					
					 And it developed different kinds of makeup and special makeup suited to the skin character of the Korean people.
					
					 It is making a research on making LED lighting apparatus based on DMX control device by its own efforts and technology.
					
					 It is introducing the standardization of digital screen in all film production groups while concentrating efforts on developing virtual photographing system and building up a database of film science and technology.

articles.title: Musical Instrument Factory Inaugurated in Phyongwon County
articles.content:
Musical Instrument Factory Inaugurated in Phyongwon County
Phyongwon, May 26 (KCNA) -- A musical instrument factory was newly built in Phyongwon County, South Phyongan Province of the DPRK.
					 Its inaugural ceremony took place on Friday.

articles.title: Pressure on Sovereign State Can Never be Unanimous Will of International Community: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
Pressure on Sovereign State Can Never be Unanimous Will of International Community: KCNA Commentary
Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- The U.S. desperately tries to create an atmosphere for sanctions and pressure on the DPRK after cooking up a brigandish story about "unanimous will of the international community" peppered with lies and fabrications.
					 Faulting the DPRK's test-launches of ground-to-ground medium-to-long range strategic ballistic rocket Hwasong-12 and strategic ballistic missile Pukguksong-2, the U.S. is urging all member nations of the UN to take prompt measures to implement all sanctions imposed on the DPRK by the UN Security Council, the package measures stipulated in Resolutions 2321 and 2270 adopted last year in particular.
					
					 Some bellicose elements of the Trump administration are going on the rampage while lording it over the UN. They threaten countries to either support north Korea or support the U.S., bluffing that any country, organization or individual supporting north Korea will be strictly sanctioned and that even though it is an international organization, it will be called into question, if it supports north Korea.
					
					 This brigandish logic meant to make all countries be obedient to its will or be subject to sanctions and pressure is rejected by the international community.
					
					 At a seminar held at U.S. Congress on May 12, an expert on Korean issue disclosed the absurdity of assertions against the DPRK, clarifying that the DPRK has made efforts for regional peace and implementation of agreements between the north and the south while the West and south Korea have resorted to false propaganda to give impression that sanctions and blockade are the only method in a bid to cover up their failed policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 Commenting on the assertion that "there is no other way of making north Korea come out for negotiations but to inflict maximum pressure and blockade", he refuted it, saying "regional situation deteriorated whenever the U.S. put pressure on north Korea".
					
					 A socio-political critic of Russia recently expected Korea will be one of the world's economic and military powers in a decade if the north and the south of it are reunified, saying that's why the U.S. and other Western media are doing their best to describe the DPRK as a monster and war is what is wanted by the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. policy-makers had better pay heed to the comments of those experts.
					
					 Sanctions and pressure on a sovereign state can never be the unanimous wish of the international community.
					
					 The DPRK has been exposed to pressure of all descriptions by big chauvinist forces, to say nothing of nuclear threat and blackmail and sanctions by the imperialists including the U.S.
					
					 Had the DPRK failed to stand the pressure by the imperialists and the chauvinists, it would have already been reduced to a colony of the imperialists or to a subject country of big chauvinists.
					
					 It is a serious lesson taught by the tragic incidents in various countries that if any nation has no strength, even though it is honest and just, it can not speak out in the international arena and would not be able to maintain justice and conscience after being reduced into the plaything of big powers.
					
					 It is by no means fortuitous that many countries are standing against the U.S. adventurous moves which rendered the situation in the Korean peninsula and the region tense and compelled the DPRK to bolster the nuclear force.
					
					 The unanimous will of the international community today is to realize independent development of sovereign states and genuine international justice.

articles.title: Removal of Pro-U.S. Conservatives in S. Korea Urged: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Removal of Pro-U.S. Conservatives in S. Korea Urged: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, an event took place in south Korea to commemorate the 37th anniversary of the Kwangju Popular Uprising, at which "March for Dear Ones", its theme song, was played again after nine years.
					 Referring to the fact, Rodong Sinmun Friday says in an article:
					
					 This is the victory the south Korean people brought in their steady struggle to terminate the fascist dictatorial rule and realize democracy.
					
					 The Kwangju Popular Uprising brought to light the heinous murderous nature of the U.S. and the south Korean military fascist clique.
					
					 To thoroughly probe the truth behind Kwangju bloodbath and punish those responsible for the crimes is an important way for eradicating the evil practices of the pro-U.S. conservative group and realizing democracy in south Korea.
					
					 The pro-U.S. conservative group has so far run the whole gamut of sleight of hand to cover up the truth of massacre they committed during the uprising. 
					
					 As long as this puppet group is allowed to persistently prevent democracy in south Korea while viciously hurting the uprising, the desire of the resistance fighters can never be realized.
					
					 The reality goes to clearly prove that only when the pro-U.S. conservative remnants are clearly eradicated, true democracy will be realized in the south Korean society.
					
					 The article stresses the need to intensify the struggle to wipe out the pro-U.S. conservative forces going against the truth and justice.

articles.title: Final Victory Is in Store for DPRK: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Final Victory Is in Store for DPRK: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Radio Sputnik of Russia and other foreign media are having a field day, commenting that America is surely going downhill.
					 Claiming the U.S. refrains from a foolhardy provocation out of its calculation that it might face an indescribably terrible disaster although it is bluffing after bringing its nuclear strategic assets to the waters off the Korean peninsula, they termed it a clear proof of the final phase of America's decline.
					
					 As commented by foreign media, the U.S. military threat to DPRK and sanctions against it, the most outrageous and malignant of their kinds, are no more than a last-ditch effort of the one whose doom is imminent, Rodong Sinmun today says in a commentary.
					
					 Giving a detailed account of the fact that the U.S. always sustained bitter defeats while the DPRK won one victory after another, the commentary goes on:
					
					 Powerful nuclear strike means of the DPRK are ready to open fire at any moment after putting within their range the U.S. mainland as well as its bases in the operational theater of the Pacific.
					
					 The fate of the U.S. has already been sealed in the standoff with the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. is bound to turn into ashes once the DPRK opens fire.
					
					 The U.S. has fully revealed its vulnerability and its doom has become a matter of time.
					
					 The DPRK will surely win the final victory in the showdown with the U.S.

articles.title: Principled Solution of Sexual Slavery Issue Urged by S. Korean Organization
articles.content:
Principled Solution of Sexual Slavery Issue Urged by S. Korean Organization
Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- The Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers Corps in south Korea issued a commentary to denounce the Japanese authorities for defying the recommendations of the UN Committee against Torture on holding renegotiations on the "agreement" over the sexual slaves for the Imperial Japanese Army.
					 The Committee in its report on May 12 recommended the modification of the "agreement" as it is insufficient in ensuring reinstatement and reparation for the victims, probe into truth and prevention of recurrence, the commentary said, adding:
					
					 The Japanese government refuted the recommendations, calling the "agreement" a "final and irreversible solution".
					
					 The "agreement" was a joint product of the Japanese government and the south Korean authorities without items concerning legal responsibility, official apology and reparation.
					
					 The commentary contended that the south Korean "government" should come out for the nullification of the "agreement", disbandment of the "foundation for reconciliation and recovery" and principled solution to the sexual slavery issue.

articles.title: S. Koreans Protest against THAAD Deployment
articles.content:
S. Koreans Protest against THAAD Deployment
Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- The co-chairman of the Kimchon Citizens No-THAAD Actions Committee staged a demonstration in protest against the deployment of THAAD outside Chongwadae on May 23, according to Yonhap News of south Korea.
					 He was holding a placard calling on the "president" to visit Songju County and take a necessary step, as demanded by the inhabitants of Kimchon City and Songju County.
					
					 Members of the All-People No-THAAD Actions joined him.
					
					 They blamed the "president" for allowing introduction of THAAD equipment though he promised to reconsider its deployment.
					
					 They urged him to stop the deployment before the reconsideration of the project.

articles.title: U.S. Connived at Kwangju Massacre: American Mediaperson
articles.content:
U.S. Connived at Kwangju Massacre: American Mediaperson
Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- An American mediaperson had a briefing on the results of findings into the classified documents of the U.S. government about Kwangju Popular Uprising at the Kwangju city office of south Korea on May 24, according to the south Korean Yonhap News.
					 A report of the U.S. Defence Department dated May 27, 1980 contained misinformation that primary schoolers were forced to take part in the uprising and the uprising was manipulated by communists.
					
					 Dismissing it as distortion of the facts, he clarified that the then U.S. government concluded that the uprising posed threat to the security and interests of the U.S., even though it had relatively good knowledge of the incident.
					
					 Accordingly, the U.S. made a decision at a White House session on May 22, 1980 to let military force take part in putting down the uprising.
					
					 Another document said that even though the U.S. government knew that the puppet airborne commandoes got approval for opening fire into citizens, it connived at it.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Lauded by Russian Media
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Lauded by Russian Media
Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Russian media gave special write-ups to the first anniversary of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's election as chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea between May 5 and 17.
					 The newspaper Byvor carried an article titled "Kim Jong Un, He Is Chairman of WPK" illustrated with photos showing his revolutionary activities.
					
					 The article said:
					
					 Chairman Kim Jong Un strengthens the WPK into steel-strong vanguard ranks advancing with the might of ideology and unity, guiding it to be a genuine mother party making selfless, devoted efforts for the good of the people.
					
					 The dignity and pride of the WPK, which is confidently leading the socialist cause along the road of victory amid the absolute trust and support of the people, are unthinkable without him.
					
					 Zebri Deve, an online paper of Khabarovsk Territory, posted an article telling about Kim Jong Un's noble outlook on the people and the posterity illustrated with his photo.
					
					 Another paper Komsomolskaya Pravda carried an article titled "Why Socialist Korea Considers Itself Invincible" illustrated with a photo of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il. The article said that the DPRK is winning victory after victory, decisively meeting all sorts of challenges of the hostile forces, under the leadership of Kim Jong Un who is fully identical to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 An online magazine Lemchich posted articles praising Kim Jong Un's matchless pluck and courage and introducing in detail the sacred history of the WPK woven with victory and glory in the annals of the revolution.

articles.title: DPRK Is Nuclear Power: Nigerian Bodies
articles.content:
DPRK Is Nuclear Power: Nigerian Bodies
Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- The National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, Group for the Study of the Juche Philosophy, Group for the Study of the Songun Politics and the Group for Self-Reliance Studies of Nigeria made a joint statement on May 17 in support of the DPRK's test-fire of ground-to-ground medium-to-long range strategic ballistic rocket Hwasong-12.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The DPRK successfully conducted the test-fire of Hwasong-12, a strategic ballistic rocket newly developed under the wise guidance of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 This is a great victory for the Korean people, an event of great importance and special significance in ensuring peace and stability of the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The U.S. should renounce its hostile policy and nuclear threat toward the DPRK, well aware of the latter's strategic position as a full-fledged nuclear power.
					
					 We extend full support to the Korean people in their struggle to foil the nuclear war moves of the U.S. and achieve peace and reunification of the Korean peninsula.

articles.title: Vicecanciller coreano se reune con el embajador ruso en Corea
articles.content:
Vicecanciller coreano se reune con el embajador ruso en Corea
Pyongyang, 26 de mayo (ACNC) -- El viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Han Song Ryol, se reunio el dia 25 con el embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la Federacion Rusa en Corea, Alexandr Matsegora, para intercambiar las opiniones sobre los problemas de interes mutuo, inclusive la actual situacion de la Peninsula Coreana.
					Haciendo referencia a la peligrosidad de los agresivos ejercicios militares conjuntos de EE.UU. y su campana de sancion anti-RPDC, el vicecanciller enfatizo que la suspension de esas acciones hostiles es la prioridad para asegurar la estabilidad de la situacion regional.
					
					El diplomatico ruso destaco la importancia de ampliar el intercambio de opiniones entre ambos paises en la situacion actual. 
					
					Ratifico la posicion del gobierno ruso en contra de la amenaza militar y sancion de EE.UU. que apuntan a la RPDC y expreso la esperanza de desarrollar de continuo las relaciones bilaterales Rusia-Corea a pesar de la situacion complicada.

articles.title: Kim Son Gyong se reune con director del MINREX del Checo
articles.content:
Kim Son Gyong se reune con director del MINREX del Checo
Pyongyang, 26 de mayo (ACNC) -- El titular de la Direccion No.2 de Europa del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Son Gyong, quien esta de visita en la Republica Checa, se reunio el dia 24 con el director para Asia y el Pacifico del MINREX del Checo, Martin Klepetko, para discutir el problema de desarrollo de las relaciones bilaterales e intercambiar las opiniones sobre la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana. 
					La parte coreana informo su posicion de desarrollar aun mas las relaciones entre los dos paises y explico que para relajar la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana y preservar la paz y estabilidad de la region, hace falta acabar con la amenaza nuclear y la politica de hostilidad a la RPDC de EE.UU. 
					
					La parte checa senalo que su pais con larga historia de relaciones con la RPDC presta profunda atencion al desarrollo de vinculos bilaterales y manifesto la voluntad de continuar el intercambio y la cooperacion en la educacion, cultura y otros dominios, a medida que se vaya aliviando la situacion. 
					
					Expreso preocupacion por el empeoramiento de la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana y apunto que se esforzara por contribuir a la solucion pacifica del problema de la Peninsula Coreana mediante el dialogo.

articles.title: Choe Ryong Hae recorre Complejo de Acero Chollima
articles.content:
Choe Ryong Hae recorre Complejo de Acero Chollima
Pyongyang, 26 de mayo (ACNC) -- Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y vicepresidente del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y del CC del PTC, averiguo en el terreno los trabajos del Complejo de Acero Chollima. 
					En varios puntos del complejo, Choe evaluo los exitos logrados por los obreros en sus faenas. 
					
					En reunion consultiva se tomaron las medidas para registrar innovaciones en la produccion de materiales de hierro y acero.

articles.title: Atletas coreanos regresan a la patria
articles.content:
Atletas coreanos regresan a la patria
Pyongyang, 26 de mayo (ACNC) -- Volvieron el dia 26 a esta capital los jugadores coreanos que habian participado en el II Campeonato Asiatico de Atletismo de Juniores, efectuado desde el dia 20 hasta el 23 en Tailandia.
					En esa cita deportiva compitieron mas de 460 atletas de ambos sexos de 40 paises y regiones, incluyendo la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, la India y Taipei China.
					
					Las jugadoras coreanas Choe Il Gyong y Kim Hyang Suk ocuparon el primer lugar en la carrera de 3 mil metros y la de 2 mil metros con vallas, respectivamente.
					
					Por otra parte, Kim Mi Hae conquisto la presea de bronce en la carrera de 2 mil metros con vallas.

articles.title: Presion sobre Estado soberano no puede ser voluntad general de sociedad internacional: comentario de ACNC
articles.content:
Presion sobre Estado soberano no puede ser voluntad general de sociedad internacional: comentario de ACNC
Pyongyang, 26 de mayo (ACNC) -- En estos tiempos, EE.UU. esta ansioso por crear el ambiente de sancion y presion contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea mintiendo que eso es la "voluntad general de la sociedad internacional". 
					Impone a todos los paises miembros del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU implementar con prisa todas las medidas de sancion anti-RPDC, tomadas por ese aparato cuestionando los lanzamientos de prueba de cohetes balisticos estrategicos tierra-tierra de largo y mediano alcance "Hwasong-12" y "Pukguksong-2", en particular, las comprensivas senaladas en las "resoluciones" 2321 y 2270 aprobadas en el ano pasado. 
					
					Algunos belicistas de la administracion Trump obligan que "tomen la decision de apoyar al Norte de Corea o a EE.UU.", amenazando con "sancionar ferreamente sobre cualquier pais, entidad o individuo que este a favor del Norte de Corea.
					
					Para colmo, ellos se ponen por encima de la ONU anunciando que cuestionarian hasta en el caso de una organizacion internacional. 
					
					Esta logica de bandido es rechazada por la sociedad internacional. 
					
					Durante el seminario bajo el tema de "El rumbo de la politica del nuevo gobierno surcoreano sobre Asia oriental y la tarea politica para la mejora de las relaciones Sur-Norte", efectuado el 12 de mayo en el Congreso norteamericano, el especialista en asuntos coreanos, argumento lo injusto de las opiniones erroneas sobre la RPDC.
					
					Preciso que la RPDC se ha esforzado por asegurar la paz regional e implementar los acuerdos Norte-Sur y por el contrario, en su intento de disimular el fracaso de su politica sobre la RPDC, el Occidente y el Sur de Corea hablaron como si la sancion y el bloqueo fueran el unico remedio. 
					
					En cuanto al criterio de que "el unico metodo para sacar al Norte de Corea a la mesa de negociaciones es la maxima presion y bloqueo", el refuto que "cada vez que EE.UU. ejercio la presion sobre la RPDC, se ha empeorado la situacion regional". 
					
					El comentarista sociopolitico ruso Nikolai Starikov pronostico que "en el caso de reunificacion del Norte y el Sur de Corea, este pais se convertira dentro de 10 anos en uno de los Estados mas poderosos del mundo en las esferas economica y militar. Agrego que "por esta razon, EE.UU. y los medios de prensa occidentales hacen todo lo posible para describir a la RPDC como un monstruo" y la "guerra es lo que desea EE.UU."
					
					Los elaboradores de la politica de EE.UU. deben tomar en consideracion tales opiniones de los especialistas. 
					
					La sancion y presion sobre un Estado soberano no pueden ser nunca la voluntad general de la sociedad internacional.
					
					Desde mucho antes, la RPDC es victima de la amenaza y chantaje nucleares y sancion de EE.UU. y otros imperialistas y de la presion de toda indole de los chovinistas de gran potencia. 
					
					Si ella se hubiera rendido ante la presion de los imperialistas y los chovinistas, ya se habria convertido en una colonia o protectorado de ellos. 
					
					Los incidentes tragicos ocurridos en varios paises ensenan la seria leccion de que un pais debil, aunque sea honesto y justo, no puede decir lo que quiera en la arena internacional ni defender la justicia y la conciencia siendo materia de regateo de las grandes potencias. 
					
					No es casual que muchos paises del mundo rechacen la aventura de EE.UU. que agrava la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana y la region y obligo a la RPDC al incremento de las fuerzas armadas nucleares. 
					
					Hoy dia, la voluntad general de la sociedad internacional esta en lograr el desarrollo independiente de los Estados soberanos y hacer valer la genuina justicia internacional.
